snippet: Nationwide, mailed ballots now account for nearly 20 percent of votes, yet such ballots are more likely to be compromised, and contested, than those cast in person, statistics show.
abstract: Mailed ballots now account for nearly 20 percent of votes nationwide, yet such ballots are less likely to be counted, more likely to be compromised and more likely to be contested; election experts say challenges created by mailed ballots could well affect outcomes in presidential election and beyond (Series: Democracy Tested).

byline.contributor: Amanda Cox contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Nationwide, mailed ballots now account for nearly 20 percent of votes, yet such ballots are more likely to be compromised, and contested, than those cast in person, statistics show.

headline.seo: As More Vote by Mail, Faulty Ballots Could Impact Elections
headline.main: Error and Fraud at Issue as Absentee Voting Rises
headline.print_headline: Error and Fraud at Issue As Absentee Voting Rises
